results.title: Casting iron plow-shares
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
This film presents Tajik men of Afghanistan performing the several stages that shape, mould and cast, in wet sands, their iron plow-shares. It explains how over the centuries this ancient craft has achieved economy of action and perfect timing. No narration - traditional music accompaniament. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Late again
results.creator_credit: Brighton Grammar School (Vic.). Film Makers Club
results.brief_description: A good example of school film making. The boys are late to school again, the master waits with a cane. The attempt to overcome their problems causes the downfall of the master’s wife.
results.description: A good example of school film making. The boys are late to school again, the master waits with a cane. The attempt to overcome their problems causes the downfall of the master’s wife.

results.title: Beard and bass
results.brief_description: An experimental short film about a bearded young man and a double bass. Clasping the instrument he tries to cross a street. Suddenly his attention is arrested by a girl whose charms he appreciates. She smiles at him and crosses the street. He stares at her and then realising suddenly that she has disappeared, he props up his double bass against the tree and disappears into the crowd. Music by George Dreyfus, edited by Peter Tammer.

results.title: Autumn: a concept film
results.brief_description: A short experimental film which focuses on one tree as it loses its leaves during the autumn season. We watch until finally the last leaf falls and the tree is completely bare. Without commentary but accompanied with music. No other credits available.

results.title: [Big Melbourne]
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Malcolm Wallhead
results.brief_description: Possible State Film Centre production. Shows a woman and her son on a journey through Melbourne’s central business district, including Flinders Street train station, St Paul’s Cathedral, shopping at Myer. Also features footage of ships and boats.

results.title: Beneath our feet. Parts 1-3
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: The Scenery of Victoria looks at the landforms throughout the state and relates the actual location to its geological significance. “Geological history of Victoria” Very similar to Part 1, but made for year 10 science with more emphasis on the period of history each geological type fits into. “Granite” looks at the formation and coding processes that produce granite with emphasis on the seven types of rocks that are currently associated with granite.

results.title: Lily
results.creator_credit: Julie Money, Women's Film Unit and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A dramatic discussion starter which confronts the social issue of racial prejudice shown through the eyes of a young Asian Australian woman, Lily. The film has the advantage of being both open-ended and humourous, allowing students to identify with the characters within the film and working as a stimulus to class discussion.

results.title: Ken Howard: saddler and harness maker
results.brief_description: Provides an insight into the life and work of Ken Howard now one of the few remaining craftsmen in the art of saddlery, who uses traditional methods in preference to new technology.

results.title: Artisans of Australia
results.creator_credit: Paul Humfress, Pamela Paddon and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A four part tape that features master stonemason George Proudmen, moulder Jack Thomas, stained glass artist Kevin Little and axemen Bill Boyd and Mark Gardner at work during conservation and restoration work on National Estate places such as Coolamine Homestead, Garrison Holy Trinity Church and the Sydney Technical College at Ultimo.

results.title: Don't think I don't think. Fair enough
results.creator_credit: Dale Baker, Open Channel Productions, La Trobe University, Preston Institute of Technology and Hodja Ed Res Co-op
results.brief_description: 1. “Don’t think I don’t think”. A workshop of the 1981 South Pacific Regional Conference on Mental Retardation. 2. “Fair enough”. The experiences of students finding difficulty in mantaining dignity and rights in the face of “hidden curricula” of school.
